  "Don" Drysdale' (July 23, 1936 â July 3, 1993) was a Major League Baseball
  player and Hall of Fame right-handed pitcher with the Los Angeles Dodgers. He
  was one of the dominant starting pitchers of the 1960s, and became a radio and
  television broadcaster following his playing career.
